channel.title: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released
channel.description:
This is the first release in the Whonix 15 series. The version number was bumped up because we are now tracking Buster as our base. To get an idea of what major fixes and features have been included in 15 check the links below:
https://forums.whonix.org/t/recent-developments-at-whonix/7152
Tickets: https://phabricator.whonix.org/project/board/132/query/vANU1Yf0Fgls/
***
Download Whonix KVM here:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/KVM#Download_Whonix

item.title: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released
item.dc:creator: Vercy
item.description:
Should I upgrade ASAP to Whonix 15 KVM ? or it’s just testing. And it’s okay if I use 2 more months Whonix 14 until Debian buster is released ?

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released

item.title: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released
item.dc:creator: onion_knight
item.description:
HulaHoop:

No, but if this is more widely requested I don’t see why not. I don’t mind running the build twice if there is a big no. of people depending on it. I guess KVM is a favorite of data-centers and a cli version hosting a HS is plausible usecase, but I need to know if this is how others feel

Yes, I guess a good use case scenario would be for instance @acis request:

Configure Hidden Service on VPS with Whonix General Tor and Anonymity Talk
Hi, I read the whonix’s documentation about how to configure a hidden service in whonix but, how can if I want to install whonix into a VPS how can I achieve it? Should I rent a RDP with windows, install virtualbox and create a virtual machine with Whonix? Is that the only and most effective way or is it better do it using linux? If so, is there any guide about it? I am trying to find a guide or tutorial about it but I don’t find it, if someone could help me I’d be grateful. Best regards

Also one could also run a XFCE gateway with minimum RAM.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released

item.title: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
onion_knight:

Does it replace Whonix 14 for KVM?

Yeah

onion_knight:

I don’t see an option to download Whonix 14 anymore, only this version, is it on purpose?

I always like to make version available so user support is more manageable. Since 15 is functional it should be OK.

onion_knight:

Also, is there any option to download a CLI version for KVM?

No, but if this is more widely requested I don’t see why not. I don’t mind running the build twice if there is a big no. of people depending on it. I guess KVM is a favorite of data-centers and a cli version hosting a HS is plausible usecase, but I need to know if this is how others feel.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released

item.source: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released

item.title: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
This is the first release in the Whonix 15 series. The version number was bumped up because we are now tracking Buster as our base. To get an idea of what major fixes and features have been included in 15 check the links below:

recent developments at Whonix News
upgrade due to apt RCE bug improved, safer, faster build process (mmdebstrap) unified (single) ova (containing both VMs) for better usability enhanced Whonix project legal protections work on cross platform build support and reproducible builds kloak - anti keystroke fingerprinting tool porting to Debian buster testers-only releases for Whonix 15

Tickets:
https://phabricator.whonix.org/project/board/132/query/vANU1Yf0Fgls/

Download Whonix KVM here:

Whonix

KVM

Using Whonix with KVM instead of VirtualBox

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix KVM 15.0.0.0.9 - Debian Buster based released
